content.description: Slab route that zig zags up the far left side of Joe Brown.
The climbing is fun and only gets a little tricky towards the end.   Going right near the top is easier than the direct finish that continues up the corner.
content.location: The obvious corner on the North West side of the face.

content.description: Starts just right of the Water Chute. Traverse right to enjoy the slabby finish on Unisloper.

Choose the middle of the slab and climb up any number of minor variants.

This is a fun slab climb.
content.location: Climbs the middle of the slab to the right of the main face.

content.description:
Climbs directly up the steep face then easy angled slab right of Waterchute.

The only interesting part of the climb is at the very start and that is over all too quick.
content.protection: Bolts and slings on top provide good anchors.
content.location: Climbs the fairly steep slab right of the Waterchute corner.

content.description:
The climb meanders directly up the slab just to the right of the steep face.   This is the first of the slab climbs here.

Good technique will help you at the start.   All the difficulties are in the first 20 feet.
content.location: Located on the left part of the slab on right of the main face.

content.description:
A powerful problem.   The hardest move of the climb is your below (5'10") is getting of the ground!

Once off the ground and on the rock a couple of hard fingery moves brings a good jug at the bottom of a depression.   Make some more good moves up on over this depression, and continue on up the slab above.
content.protection: Slings and bolts provide good anchors on top.
content.location: Climbs the up just right of center on the West facing wall

content.description:
A good climb.   Start below and to the left of the obvious 'eye' in the rock.   Make some hard moves up and along a rail until you have the eye by the socket.

Don't hang around too long before heading up onto easier ground.
content.protection:
Slings and bolts provide good anchors.

Two top-roping bolts on top of Joe Brown boulder are loose and rusted. I would not trust them. Need replacement.
content.location: Located just left of center on the steep West face.

content.description: Climbs the left had edge of the Waterchute corner.   Small edges and horizontal seems provide all the features you need to climb this exposed slab.
content.protection: Slings useful at the top for the anchor.
content.location: Lies on the far right of the Northern slabby face.

content.description: Climbs the middle of the slab, trending right towards the top.   The starting moves are tricky, and there is one tricky section in the middle, but trusting your feet on the rough granite will get you through.
content.protection: Long slings are useful at the top for the anchor.   Take care to ensure that the anchor doesn't swing too far.
content.location: Climbs the middle of the North slabby face.

pathTokens: Joe Brown and Half Dome Area
